thread.title_full: Trains Short Terminated: Railways short terminates two trains on KK line due to rain | - Times of India

author: TNN
title: Trains Short Terminated: Railways short terminates two trains on KK line due to rain | - Times of India
text: Koraput: Owing to incessant rain in Kirandul area of Chhattisgarh, railways has announced the short termination of two trains on the KK line from Thursday to August 8. In an official release, the railways stated that the Visakhapatnam-Kirandul passenger special, departing from Visakhapatnam, will be short-terminated at Dantewada. Similarly, in its return journey, the Kirandul-Visakhapatnam passenger special will commence from Dantewada, instead of Kirandul from August 2 to 8. tnnWe also published the following articles recentlyCentral Railway (CR): Harbour trains to terminate at Sandhurst Road?Central Railway (CR) considered terminating Harbour line services at Sandhurst Road to create space for new lines between CSMT and Parel. The plan included using platforms 1 and 2 for Main line services and demolishing fast corridor platforms at Byculla. The feasibility of these proposals, involving land acquisition, was being checked.112152315Fire breaks out at Visakhapatnam hospital, no casualtiesA fire erupted in the cellar of a private hospital in Venkojipalem, Visakhapatnam on Monday night due to exploding UPS batteries. Fortunately, there were no injuries, but the incident created panic among patients and their relatives. Fire personnel extinguished the blaze while an investigation is ongoing to determine the precise cause of the fire.112127826Tributes paid to Kargil War heroes on the occasion of Vijay Diwas at VisakhapatnamOn the 25th Anniversary of Kargil Vijay Diwas, Eastern Naval Command held a Wreath Laying ceremony at the War Memorial, RK Beach, in Visakhapatnam. Vice Admiral Sameer Saxena and other dignitaries participated. The event honored the bravery of soldiers in the Kargil War. Sainik School Korukonda observed the day with speeches and a documentary on the war's milestones.112049171
